conditions.short_description: Snowing on Thursday in the eastern and norther parts of the country way cause wind slab formation.
conditions.full_description: Snowing on Thursday in the eastern and norther parts of the country way cause wind slab formation. Older snow is generally stiff, mostly homogeneous and stable after thaw followed by freezing. Surface hoar can be buried during snow fall in the mountains.

area_forecast.forecast: Little snow is in the area and generally considered stable.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Not much snow is in the area and snow in the mountains is considered stable.
area_forecast.weather: Úrkomulítið á fimmtudag og föstudag, NA-átt og getur verið hvasst til fjalla.

area_forecast.forecast: Little new snow is on top of old stiff and stable snow that has been to melt-freeze cycles.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow subsided and settled in the warm spell on Thursday 20.11. and got stiff and strong in the freezing temperatures that followed. Little new snow has fallen since the thaw, wind has been calm so it has not drifted and snow got wet at lower elevations on Tuesday 25.11. On Thursday 27.11., rather strong NE wind is forecast, but as there is little snow available to drift, real wind slab formation is not expected.
area_forecast.weather: Allhvöss NA-átt á fimmtudag en úrkomulítið. Hæg breytileg átt, þurrt og kalt í kjölfarið.

area_forecast.forecast: Snow is in the mountains and the snowpack is generally considered stable in the area. New snow may form small slabs during snow and wind on Thursday.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Older snow in the mountains is considered stable after freezing and thawing. In the recent cold, surface hoar may have formed on the existing snowpack in upper elevations but will likely disappear in wind on Thursday. Small slabs may form in the mountains on Thursday.
area_forecast.weather: Á fimmtudag má búast við lítilháttar snjókomu en hvassri NA-átt til fjalla. Áfram hvasst á föstudag en snýr í norðanátt með éljagangi fyrripart dags.

area_forecast.forecast: New unstable wind slabs are expected to form on Thursday due to snowfall and snowdrift from NE and N, especially in slopes and gullies facing south and west.
area_forecast.recent_avalances: Small sluffs and snowball rolls were spotted in Norðfjörður Saturday 22.11, in south facing slopes close to the tops. A slab avalanche was observed in western slope on Sauðatindur (Innra Hólafjall), about 1000 m elevation. Release time is uncertain, probably in the thaw last week.
area_forecast.snow_condition: Snow is widely stiff and rather stable after melt-freeze cycles. At high elevations, where thaw has had less impact, unstable slabs may still exist in isolated places, especially in south-facing gullies and below ridges. On Thursday, new wind slabs are expected to form due to considerable snowfall and snowdrift in NE-N winds, especially in slopes and gullies facing south and west. The new wind slabs may be unstable.
area_forecast.weather: Hvessir á fimmtudag úr norðaustri með talsverðum éljagangi og skafrenningi, mest ákefð um kvöldið. Snýst svo í norðanátt og dregur úr éljum, sem verða þó viðvarandi fram á laugardag. Kólnar smám saman.

weather_forecast.forecast: Snowing on Thursday in East and North parts during a strong NE-direction. Snow showers continue in N-direction on Friday.
